jdbc.query

Class RequestQueries

  • java.lang.Object
    • jdbc.query.RequestQueries

  • public class RequestQueries
extends java.lang.Object
    Handles database queries related to requests, including fetching, updating, and inserting new requests. This class is primarily used for managing park manager requests, such as changes in park parameters or settings.
    Author:
    Tamer Amer, Gal Bitton, Rabea Lahham, Bahaldeen Swied, Ron Sisso, Nadav Reubens.

      • RequestQueries

        public RequestQueries()

    • Method Detail

      • ShowAllParkManagerRequests

        public ServerResponse ShowAllParkManagerRequests(java.util.ArrayList<Request> request)
        Retrieves all pending requests from the database. This method is intended for park managers to view and act on requests that are currently awaiting approval.
        Parameters:
        request - An empty ArrayList of Request that will be filled with the found requests.
        Returns:
        ServerResponse indicating the outcome of the fetch operation, whether it was successful, there are no pending requests, or the query failed.

      • UpdateStatusRequest

        public ServerResponse UpdateStatusRequest(Request request,
                                          java.lang.String status)
        Updates the status of a specific request in the database to a new status provided by the caller. If the new status is 'Approved', it also triggers the update of the relevant park parameter to the new value specified in the request.
        Parameters:
        request - The Request object containing the request details, including the request ID.
        status - The new status to be set for the request, typically 'Approved' or 'Denied'.
        Returns:
        ServerResponse indicating whether the update was successful, failed, or if the query resulted in no changes.

      • InsertNewRequest

        public boolean InsertNewRequest(Request request)
        Inserts a new request into the database, provided there's no existing pending request of the same type for the same park. This method ensures that duplicate requests are not created while a similar request is still under consideration.
        Parameters:
        request - The Request object to be inserted, containing all necessary details such as park ID, request type, old and new values, request status, and request date.
        Returns:
        A boolean value indicating the success of the insert operation. Returns true if the insert was successful, or false if a matching pending request already exists or if the insert operation failed.
